intro: Panopsis suaveolens, commonly known as the sweet-scented panopsis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, ovate leaves that emit a pleasant fragrance when crushed. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with five petals and a prominent central corolla, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and unique scent, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
